events.message: The customer has filed a claim reporting a vehicle accident that occurred on the morning of April 30. The report includes initial details on the collision and involved parties.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident case after reviewing the details describing the car collision and damage to the vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case promptly to assist the claimant and begin the processing of the auto accident claim.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer including information about the next steps for handling the auto accident.
The claimant was requested to provide documents such as police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driverâ€™s license.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the collision damage and the official police report.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the auto accident, including contacting witnesses and reviewing submitted evidence.
The investigation was completed successfully, confirming the liability and extent of damage from the collision for further claim processing.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the customer based on the assessed vehicle damages and policy coverage limits.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the communication and claim handling.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal.
The payment covering the approved amount for vehicle repairs was issued to the claimant's designated bank account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming the receipt of payment and customer satisfaction.
